In Fortran, to get the binary representation of an integer, we can use the bit_size and bit functions, but perhaps it's easier to compute it manually. Function to convert integer to binary string (as a string of '0's and '1's):

subroutine int_to_bin_str(n, s)
    integer, intent(in) :: n
    character(len=*), intent(out) :: s
    integer :: i, len
    s = ''
    if (n ==0) then
        s = '0'
        return
    end if
    do while (n >0)
        s = trim(adjustl( mod(n,2) )) // s
        n = n /2
    end do
end subroutine int_to_bin_str

children.text:
Bubble sort subroutine
    subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)
        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
        integer, intent(in) :: n
        integer :: i, j, temp do i =1, n-1
            do j =1, n-i
                if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then
                    temp = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = arr(j+1)
                    arr(j+1) = temp
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end subroutine bubble_sort

    ! Function to convert integer to binary string
    subroutine int_to_bin_str(n, s)
        integer, intent(in) :: n
        character(len=*), intent(out) :: s
        integer :: i, pos
        s = ''
        if (n ==0) then
            s = '0'
            return
        end if
        do while (n >0)
            s = trim(adjustl( mod(n,2) )) // s
            n = n /2
        end do
    end subroutine int_to_bin_str

end program main

children.text:
Bubble sort subroutine
    subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)
        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
        integer, intent(in) :: n
        integer :: i, j, temp do i =1, n-1
            do j =1, n-i
                if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then
                    temp = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = arr(j+1)
                    arr(j+1) = temp
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end subroutine bubble_sort

    ! Function to convert integer to binary string
    subroutine int_to_bin_str(n, s)
        integer, intent(in) :: n
        character(len=*), intent(out) :: s
        character(len=1) :: temp_char
        s = ''
        if (n ==0) then
            s = '0'
            return
        end if
        do while (n >0)
            temp_char = char(ichar('0') + mod(n,2))
            s = trim(adjustl(temp_char)) // s
            n = n /2
        end do
    end subroutine int_to_bin_str

end program main

subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)
    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
    integer, intent(in) :: n
    integer :: i, j, temp
    do i = 1, n-1
        do j = 1, n-i
            if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then
                temp = arr(j)
                arr(j) = arr(j+1)
                arr(j+1) = temp
            end if
        end do
    end do
end subroutine bubble_sort

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: n, i, c, count_ones, mask, count_zeros, count_ones_sub, value, ans_third
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: list
    character(len=64) :: s_bin, s_sub, s_47
    logical :: found

    ! First part: read input and compute c

    read *, n
    allocate(list(n))
    read *, list

    ! Sort the list (using bubble sort)
    call bubble_sort(list, n)

    c =1
    do i =1, n
        if (list(i) >= c) then
            c = c +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Second part: count the 1s in binary of c
    count_ones =0
    integer :: temp = c
    do while (temp >0)
        if (mod(temp,2) ==1) then
            count_ones = count_ones +1
        end if
        temp = temp /2
    end do

    ! Third part: find the minimal 4/7 number >= count_ones
    ans_third = -1
    mask =2

    do while (ans_third == -1)
        ! Convert mask to binary string
        call int_to_bin_str(mask, s_bin)
        ! Get substring starting at second character
        s_sub = s_bin(2: len_trim(s_bin))
        ! Count zeros and ones in s_sub
        count_zeros =0
        count_ones_sub =0
        do i =1, len_trim(s_sub)
            if (s_sub(i:i) == '0') then
                count_zeros = count_zeros +1
            else if (s_sub(i:i) == '1') then
                count_ones_sub = count_ones_sub +1
            end if
        end do
        if (count_zeros /= count_ones_sub) then
            mask = mask +1
            cycle
        end if
        ! Form the 4/7 string
        s_47 = ''
        do i =1, len_trim(s_sub)
            if (s_sub(i:i) == '0') then
                s_47 = trim(adjustl(s_47)) // '4'
            else
                s_47 = trim(adjustl(s_47)) // '7'
            end if
        end do
        ! Parse to integer
        read(s_47, *) value
        if (value >= count_ones) then
            ans_third = value
        else
            mask = mask +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Output the result
    print *, ans_third

contains

    ! Bubble sort subroutine
    subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)
        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
        integer, intent(in) :: n
        integer :: i, j, temp
        do i =1, n-1
            do j =1, n-i
                if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then
                    temp = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = arr(j+1)
                    arr(j+1) = temp
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end subroutine bubble_sort

    ! Function to convert integer to binary string
    subroutine int_to_bin_str(n, s)
        integer, intent(in) :: n
        character(len=*), intent(out) :: s
        integer :: i, pos
        s = ''
        if (n ==0) then
            s = '0'
            return
        end if
        do while (n >0)
            s = trim(adjustl( mod(n,2) )) // s
            n = n /2
        end do
    end subroutine int_to_bin_str

end program main

contains

    ! Bubble sort subroutine

            s = '0'
            return
        end if
        do while (n >0)
            temp_char = char(ichar('0') + mod(n,2))
            s = trim(adjustl(temp_char)) // s
            n = n /2
        end do
    end subroutine int_to_bin_str

end program main
